items.title: India's wholesale prices fall 1.21% year-on-year in October
items.summary: India’s wholesale price inflation fell to –1.21% in October, reversing from 0.13% in September, led by sharp declines in food, fuel and manufactured goods. Food articles saw 8.31% deflation, with vegetables at –34.97%, pulses at –16.50%, potatoes at –39.88%, and onions at –65.43%. Fuel and power recorded –2.55% inflation, while manufactured products eased to 1.54%.

items.title: Amazon slashes nearly 700 jobs in New York alone amid plans of 14,000 job cuts – here's what we know

items.title: Phones may soon connect directly to satellites as DoT plans D2D satcom services framework
items.summary: India is planning to enable direct satellite connectivity for mobile phones, potentially bringing ubiquitous internet to remote areas. The Department of Telecommunications will seek recommendations from TRAI on a framework for these direct-to-device (D2D) services, including pricing. This move aims to make phone connectivity as seamless as 4G/5G, though telcos have raised concerns about business impact.

items.summary: Verizon layoffs: American telecommunications company is set to reduce 15,000 jobs as subscriber growth slows down and competition rises.

items.title: Aviom India Housing Finance promoter offers to settle dues as six entities put in bids
items.summary: According to the proposal, there would be an upfront payment of Rs 350 crore while the accrued interest would be paid in 24 months after the initial 26 months of principal payment. Ilmi's plan also includes full repayment to operational creditors and employees amounting to Rs 2.9 crore. She has also suggested that lenders appoint a professional CEO to run the company during the proposed repayment period. The proposal recommends the appointment of five directors, including two lender nominees, and includes an indemnity agreement between the company and these directors.

items.title: RBI has room to cut rates, can't predict timing: Economists
items.summary: "While the inflation trajectory is likely to remain benign, the RBI will need to filter the festive and GST-related demand from the cyclical recovery," said Upasna Bharadwaj, chief economist, Kotak Mahindra Bank. "We remain skeptical on the sustainability of the recent pickup in economic activity and, hence, see some room for further monetary easing."

items.title: Policy support key for Tata Steel UK: CFO
items.summary: While losses narrowed year-on-year in the UK operations in the September quarter, the performance trailed the management's guidance. Back in 2024, Tata had said these operations would turn profitable at an operating level in FY25. Tata Steel is working on slashing costs. It is also engaging with the British government on policy-related issues as imports in certain product segments are higher than even the total consumption in the country.

items.title: ET Graphics | Big Wheels: Small car sales may surge to 5-year high
items.summary: Small car sales are projected to reach a five-year high of approximately 749,000 units between September and November. This surge is fueled by robust demand for compact SUVs, made more accessible by a recent 10-percentage-point GST reduction. Compact SUVs are expected to constitute half of all small car sales during this festive period.

items.title: DWS Group to buy 40% in Nippon Life India AIF biz
items.summary: As part of the memorandum of understanding (MoU), DWS, formerly Deutsche Asset Management, and Nippon will also jointly launch passive products. Both firms also aim for a global distribution arrangement to develop and distribute actively-managed mutual funds with India-focused strategies through DWS' global distribution network, the release said.

items.title: Coal minister tells PSUs to boost rare mineral sampling
items.summary: In a recent address, Coal Minister G Kishan Reddy emphasized the necessity for public sector companies to ramp up their efforts in testing for rare earth elements and essential minerals. He also pointed out the critical role of establishing coal washeries to improve the quality of coal and lessen dependency on imports.

items.title: Mahindra & Mahindra, Manulife plan new drive, in life insurance
items.summary: Under the agreement, both partners will commit up to Rs 3,600 crore each, with an initial investment of Rs 1,250 crore planned over the first five years. The Mahindra Group expects to deploy about Rs 250 crore a year over this period, while Manulife will contribute an equal amount. The two partners will apply for a license in 2-3 months, and operations are expected to begin within 15-18 months of regulatory approval.

items.title: Hospitals and insurers urged to make health cover affordable
items.summary: The Finance Ministry has urged insurance companies and hospitals to collaborate on reducing health insurance costs. The aim is to make healthcare more affordable and accessible for policyholders. Measures like standardized treatment protocols and seamless cashless claims processing were discussed. This initiative follows recent regulations capping premium hikes for senior citizens, addressing concerns over rising costs.

items.title: Local sneaker brands have stories to tell and comfort to sell
items.summary: Indian sports shoe brands are creating unique designs with Indian elements. These brands target young consumers with stylish and comfortable footwear. Many are seeing repeat purchases and attracting investor interest. Companies are expanding manufacturing and offline presence. The sports shoe market in India is growing significantly.

items.title: Easier imports for key sectors as 14 BIS quality orders scrapped
items.summary: The QCOs, which are compulsory certifications given by the Bureau of Indian Standards (BIS), increased compliance costs for small businesses, leading to higher prices for consumers and reduced competitiveness, especially for micro, small and medium enterprises (MSMEs) and export-oriented industries.

items.title: Urgent update: On the India’s Consumer Price Index
items.summary: India needs to revise its Consumer Price Index urgently

items.title: Small pharma firms may face closure as regulator tightens quality checks
items.summary: Many small drug makers face closure as regulators inspect facilities for quality standards. Thousands of plants may shut down if upgrades are not made. This could lead to drug shortages. Industry groups are seeking more time to comply. The government has set a deadline for these upgrades. Companies must submit plans for improvement.

items.title: Boost financial inclusion with fair rates: DFS Secy to MFIs
items.summary: Microfinance institutions are urged to maintain fair interest rates.  The Department of Financial Services secretary expressed concern over declining loan accounts and outstanding amounts.  MFIs play a crucial role in financial inclusion and women's empowerment.  Efforts are underway to address rising stress in the MFI sector and support rural borrowers.  A new credit score framework is being developed.

items.title: India asks Russia to help speed up listing of domestic firms, products
items.summary: India has requested Russia to speed up the listing of its establishments and registration of marine and pharma products. This move aims to significantly increase bilateral trade between the two nations. Both countries are working towards a target of $100 billion in trade by 2030. Discussions also covered cooperation in various sectors and exploring payment solutions for businesses.

items.title: Dealers of used cars flag vehicle transfer issues post Delhi's Red Fort blast
items.summary: A central government portal for vehicle ownership transfer faces issues. This is causing problems in identifying current owners after incidents. A used car involved in a recent Delhi bomb blast was still registered to its original owner. This highlights the challenges in the system. Efforts are underway to improve accuracy and link mobile numbers to owners.

items.title: Anti-dumping duty imposed on Vietnam steel for five years
items.summary: India has taken a bold stance against unfair trade practices by imposing an anti-dumping duty on steel imports from Vietnam, specifically targeting hot-rolled flat steel products for the next five years. This decisive action aims to block the rerouting of Chinese steel into Indian markets.

items.title: 'GST cuts shave 0.12 pp off October retail inflation'
items.summary: With October's retail inflation dipping to a historic low of just 0.25%, recent GST reductions are starting to show their impact, albeit subtly. A substantial drop in food prices has been noted, prompting Nomura to project even further price declines ahead.

items.title: TV channels may find it harder to boost viewership via landing pages
items.summary: BARC measures television viewership through an audio watermark that embeds a unique, inaudible code into broadcast feeds. Peoplemeters installed in some households detect these codes to record which channels are being watched and for how long.

items.title: Statistics ministry to launch migration survey from July next year
items.summary: India's statistics ministry will conduct a nationwide migration survey from July 2026 to June 2027. This survey will gather crucial data on migration reasons, patterns, and impacts. It aims to understand labour mobility, urbanisation, and migrant integration. Previous data showed a decline in domestic migrants. The ministry seeks feedback on the survey plan.

items.title: ET Graphics: October inflation eases to record low after GST cuts
items.summary: Prices saw a significant drop in October. This followed a recent goods and service tax rationalisation. Reductions in GST rates lowered costs for electrical appliances, automobiles, and food items. Retail inflation eased to a record low of 0.25%. This marks the third time in FY26 inflation remained below the Reserve Bank of India's target range.

items.title: 'India set to be among fastest-growing economies with 6.5% expansion in 2027': Moody's
items.summary: India is gearing up for an impressive economic surge, with forecasts suggesting a growth rate of 6.5% for both 2026 and 2027. This resilience is primarily fueled by enhanced infrastructure investment and robust household spending.

items.title: Odisha in talks with NTPC, NPCIL for nuclear power plants
items.summary: Odisha is taking bold steps into the nuclear energy landscape by partnering with NTPC and NPCIL. This endeavor symbolizes the state's commitment to a sustainable energy horizon. Current research and analysis are paving the way for collaborative ventures that could harness Odisha's rich thorium deposits, an essential asset for advancing India's nuclear ambitions.

items.summary: The government is likely to soon allocate  ₹2,000 crore for the Credit Guarantee Scheme for Exporters, enabling NCGTC to provide credit facilities of up to  ₹20,000 crore to eligible exporters. Here's all you need to know…

Despite this, the group's overall revenue increased. This financial performance reflects challenges faced by Air India, including operational disruptions and regulatory scrutiny.

items.summary: Godrej Consumer Products Ltd (GCPL) has acquired male grooming brand Muuchstac for Rs 450 crore, with founders Vishal and Ronak continuing to lead the business.  GCPL is actively seeking more D2C acquisitions, impressed by Muuchstac's profitable growth driven by its successful face wash product and micro-influencer marketing strategy.

This move aims to bolster the loss-making carrier's strategic direction and growth initiatives.

items.summary: J&K Bank has a new part-time chairman. The Reserve Bank of India has approved S Krishnan for the role. His term begins on November 13, 2025, and will continue until March 26, 2028. Krishnan previously served as MD & CEO of Punjab & Sind Bank. He also held the top position at Tamilnad Mercantile Bank.

A significant 78% plan to increase investments in the next six months, driven by Saudi's growing economy, stability, and business-friendly policies.

items.summary: Global banks face new challenges from digitalization and AI. These changes will impact business models and risk management. Credit losses are expected to rise, particularly in the Asia-Pacific region. However, strong profitability and regulations should keep these losses manageable. The banking sector is set for significant shifts.

This decline is attributed to temporary flight disruptions from altered airspace conditions due to geopolitical events and ongoing runway upgradation at the airport.

This can impact gear shifting. Honda will replace the faulty part free of charge. The replacement process begins in January 2026 at BigWing Topline dealerships across India.

items.summary: Tata Steel's financial performance improved due to increased production in India and cost-cutting measures, though UK operations remain weak. The company may fall short of its 40 mtpa capacity target by 2030.

items.title: Northeast India small tea growers demand fair price for green leaves

They are urging the government to implement a Minimum Support Price or Fair and Remunerative Price mechanism. This aims to protect them from market volatility. The growers also seek government support through agricultural schemes, including subsidies for machinery and inputs.

items.title: Govt proposes Seeds Bill to curb sale of spurious seeds, seeks comments on draft
items.summary: For a major offence, the Bill proposes ₹10 lakh penalty and a fine of ₹20 lakh for subsequent offences if committed within 5 years. Any subsequent major offence after being fined ₹20 lakh will attract a penalty of ₹30 lakh and cancellation of dealership licence or three years imprisonment.

items.title: Higher growth in Q2 and record low Oct inflation may pose a serious dilemma for RBI rate action in Dec, say economists

items.title: TVS SCS estimates annualised savings of ₹100-120 crore from strategic rejig of UK and Europe businesses

This includes upgrading hardware and moving to new software. SBI is also externalizing some functions and using microservices. A private cloud is being built for scalability and security.

items.title: RBI reconstitutes Committee of Advisors of Irinjalakuda Town Co-op Bank
items.summary: The Reserve Bank of India has reshuffled the Committee of Advisors for Irinjalakuda Town Co-operative Bank. This follows the earlier superseding of the bank's board due to financial and governance issues. Raju S Nair continues as Administrator. Mohanan K and Mohan T M now form the new Committee of Advisors.

This record deal highlights a growing trend where ultra-high-net-worth individuals view premium homes as high-performing financial assets, moving beyond mere lifestyle statements to strategic investments.

Jio is already getting proposals for tariff products based on this technology. They point to global regulators in the US and UK that have adapted their net neutrality rules.

items.summary: According to Geojit, Global consumption of edible oils is expected to fall 30-40% in 2020 because of coronavirus lockdowns, said Dominic Xavier, Middle East and North Africa region head at Sime Darby Oils.

items.title: Oil falls further amid growing alarm over coronavirus second wave
items.summary: The biggest global health crisis in a century continues to flare unabated with cases rising in India, Great Britain, Spain and several parts of the United States, where the infection rate has not come under control for months.

items.title: Gold flat as dollar strength counters safe-haven demand
items.summary: Spot gold was little changed at $1,929.30 per ounce by 0038 GMT, after falling to a near two-week week low of $1,906.24 on Tuesday.

items.title: Gold may witness choppy trade, expect buying at lower levels: Kotak Securities
items.summary: After weeks of consolidation, crude oil has come under pressure amid signs of correction in US equity market and gains in US dollar index.

items.title: Energy Weekly Report: Motilal Oswal
items.summary: According to Motilal Oswal, Oil prices hit a rough patch last week, falling back in line with broader financial markets. Prices did try to inch higher, but experienced selling pressure at highs.

items.title: Precious Metals Weekly Report: Motilal Oswal
items.summary: According to Motilal Oswal, Gold fell to the lowest level in a month primarily as the dollar rose against its major crosses and better-than-expected economic number from the US.

items.title: Base Metals Weekly Report: Motilal Oswal
items.summary: According to Motilal Oswal, Base metals traded choppy last week, with prices hitting multi month highs at the start of the week and followed by some profit taking on back of volatility in the dollar and mixed data signals from China and US.

items.title: Flipkart records highest-ever single day sale, grosses $200mn
items.summary: This is the biggest ever single day sale for Bangalore-based Flipkart, since the time the company started in 2007.

items.title: Subramanian Swamy seeks ban on import of cement from Pakistan
items.summary: "Allowing imports of cement from Pakistan, therefore, carried with it the additional risk in that it provides an effective cover for smuggling of contraband goods and harmful weapons and ammunition concealed in cement bags which comes in rakes and trucks, in the hands of disruptionist elements," he said.

items.title: Moneycontrol Exclusive: Govt plans overhaul of tax administration for smooth GST rollout
items.summary: The government has readied plans for a major change in India’s tax administration structure, including overhauling the Central Board of Excise and Customs (CBEC) to ensure a glitch-free roll-out of a nation-wide goods and services tax (GST).

items.title: Sensex, Nifty wobbly; Hind Zinc, SBI, Force Motors most active
items.summary: Asian Paints, SBI, Tata Motors, HUL and Maruti Suzuki are top gainers while ONGC, Axis Bank, MM, Bajaj Auto and Hero MotoCorp are major losers in the Sensex.

items.title: Uber  redBus partner with ixigo for train travellers
items.summary: ixigo, India’s leading mobile travel marketplace has announced partnerships with Uber and redBus to enable instant bookings for cabs and buses natively within ixigo trains app.

items.title: Workload in IT to come down due to AI; jobs to reduce: Genpact
items.summary: But along with that the employment growth rates have started to dip, NV 'Tiger' Tyagarajan says. The percentage addition of employees in India will not be same as past. And due to advancements, a workforce with higher skill sets is required for the IT industry, he says.

items.title: Pixel launch: Is Google Assistant's AI an assault on privacy?
items.summary: Sure, artificial intelligence can make life simpler by suggesting you places to eat, tell you weather, or even crack a joke.  The more you use it, the more it learns about your habits and preferences. The protocols pertaining to artificial intelligence, or the lack of it, make our data less secure and more vulnerable.

items.title: Up over 200% in 1 year, what's buzzing with Borosil Glass?
items.summary: Shares of Borosil Glass Works have increased threefold over the past one year as the company has posted strong revenue and EBIDTA growth over the past few quarters.

items.title: Why you should not be always chasing returns
items.summary: Most people focus on returns and chase products that offer the best returns at any point.

items.title: Jhunjhunwala-partnered fund buys stake in TFCI: What's buzzing?
items.summary: In an interview with CNBC-TV18, Satpal Arora, MD of Tourism Finance Corporation of India (TFCI), talked about the state of business and the outlook ahead.

items.title: RBI latest meeting 'diluted' its old policy framework: Nomura
items.summary: On Tuesday, the central bank surprised the market with a 25-basis-point cut to its policy repo rate, or the rate at which it lends to banks, to 6.25 percent.

items.title: Bond bull market may pause but is far from over: Expert
items.summary: The benchmark 10-year government-security yield remained stuck in 8-7.5 percent range through all of 2015 and half of 2016, moving lower to sub-7 percent only when the RBI promised in April to reduce the system's liquidity deficit. The yield may now fall more.

items.title: Scope for meaningful rate cuts going ahead: Neelkanth Mishra
items.summary: Credit Suisse' Neelkanth Mishra expects repo rate to fall to a decade low in the coming quarters. He says that beginning December the market may see a robust and widespread pick-up which may boost indices.

items.title: Tech up to a healthier world
items.summary: Sensors, 3D printed skin, wearables, reconstructed organs, revolutionized clinical trials, personalized medicine and what not – get ready for a new era of healthcare

items.title: Steel stocks rally as govt extends MIP on 66 steel products
items.summary: Stocks like Hindustan Zinc, Hindalco, Jindal Steel, JSW Steel and Tata Steel gained over 1 percent from previous close.

items.title: Endurance Technologies IPO opens: Should you subscribe?
items.summary: The Aurangabad-based company aims to mop up nearly Rs 1,162 crore (at higher end of price band) by diluting 17.5 percent stake through the issue that will close on October 7. It already raised Rs 348.52 crore through anchor investors' portion on Tuesday, the day before issue opening.

items.title: Cautiously optimistic on India; eyeing earnings revival: Sanger
items.summary: Global liquidity tailwinds are unlikely to get any better from now and that makes Arvind Sanger, Managing Partner at Geosphere Capital Management “cautiously optimistic” on the Indian markets.

items.title: Automation threatens 69% jobs in India: World Bank
items.summary: "In large parts of Africa, it is likely that technology could fundamentally disrupt this pattern. Research based on World Bank data has predicted that the proportion of jobs threatened in India by automation is 69 percent, in China it is 77 percent and in Ethiopia, the percentage of jobs threatened by automation is 85 percent," he said.
